WorkItem.Description:
Hello,
 
I've encountered a problem with exception handling when using Framework 4.0 instead of 3.5.
 
This problem also exists in the current (upgraded) version of Prism (Prism 4.0 CTP - August 2010).
 
How to get the Error:
 
 
start the "StockTrader RI" destop version
create a new buy-order for first stock
try to enter a negative number, like -5 in the Shares text box
in the old version, the textbox got a red border and now an exception is raised
 
I would appreciate it a lot if you could help me with this problem. Maybe I've some wrong settings, but I don't think so.
 
Thank you!
 
Harald
WorkItem.Summary: Exception Handling with WPF 4.0 doesn't work as with WPF 3.5

Comments.Message:
For those who are concerned with this issue, we've found that as of the November 2010 release of Prism 4, this behavior is correct. In case you enter an invalid value such as a negative number in the Shares text box of the dialog to add a new buy-order, the textbox gets a red border and no exception is thrown.

Thank you for your feedback.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
